Subject: The order of default builders.
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=223548916; y=1jSVsFm9OVsBHCehMM8xuTR49VFPqGtDZhAQnhezkxlIRx5vWtQ

Hi everyone,

So, AllDefaultPossibilitiesBuilder has ignoredBuilder() before
annotated builder as shown here:

	@Override
	public Runner runnerForClass(Class<?> testClass) throws Throwable {
		List<RunnerBuilder> builders= Arrays.asList(
				ignoredBuilder(),
				annotatedBuilder(),
                                ...

I understand this was done to enforce consistent handling of @Ignore
at class level but it sucks if you want to have a custom runner that
wishes to handle @Ignore on class in a different manner. In
particular, I'm looking to report the descriptions of all ignored unit
tests (rather than just skipping the entire class).

Changing the order above will most likely break annotated runners that
are not prepared to handle class-level @Ignore. Any other suggestions/
options how this could be solved? This could be a tweak to
IgnoredBuilder to delegate to a sub-runner if it sees @RunWith and
then just fire ignore events for each individual test?

Dawid
subject: The order of default builders.
